text: Jean-Claude Wicky (28 January 1946 – 31 July 2016) was a Swiss photographer. He was noted for his series on Bolivian miners (1984–2001). He was born in Moutier, Switzerland. His photos have been exhibited at the Swiss Foundation for Photography, the Musée de l'Élysée in Lausanne, and the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, as well as in magazines including GEO and Smithsonian Magazine. Wicky died on 31 July 2016 in Biel/Bienne, Switzerland at the age of 70. == References == == Other websites == * Mountains of Pain —Abstract of Smithsonian article on the miners at Cerro Rico, illustrated with photographs by Wicky. * The Mineros photography exhibition * Category:1946 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Swiss photographers Category:People from the canton of Bern Category:Jura bernois (administrative district) Category:20th- century artists Category:21st-century artists
title: Jean-Claude Wicky
